alert.note: Alert for Central and Southern Scott County; Northern Montgomery County Higher Elevations; Northern Polk County Higher Elevations; Northern Scott County; Northwest Yell County; Polk County Lower Elevations; Southeast Polk County Higher Elevations; Southern and Eastern Logan County; Western and Northern Logan County; Yell Excluding Northwest (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 6:01AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Logan, Scott, northern Polk, west central Yell and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 645 AM CDT... At 601 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Midland to near Hartford to 6 miles north of Muse. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mena... Booneville... Waldron... Mansfield... Magazine... Blue Mountain... Beauchamp... Cardiff... Mountain Fork... Stonehouse Recreation Area... Gravelly... Polk County Fairgrounds... Mena Intermountain Airport... Oliver... Echo... Morgan Springs... Queen Wilhelmina State Park... Havana... Bates... Acorn... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CDT for western Arkansas.
